subject: Re: [junit] Re: tests in separate directory, was: testing private  methods
msgSnippet: ... Eclipse is very similar... - ... src main + com.xyz.package1 + com.xyz.package2 - ... src test + com.xyz.package1 + com.xyz.package2 Mike -- Mike Clark
messageBody:
Craig Demyanovich wrote:

> IDEA (http://www.intellij.com) has a source tree view that is perfect
> for this situation. With tests in the same package but in different
> project subtrees, the view looks like this:
>
> - ... \src\main
> - com
> - <company>
> + <pkg1>
> + <pkg2>
>
> - ... \src\test
> - com
> - <company>
> + <pkg1>
> + <pkg2>
>
> With all that I've heard about Eclipse, I'm surprised this type of view
> is not present.

Eclipse is very similar...

- ... \src\main
+ com.xyz.package1
+ com.xyz.package2

- ... \src\test
+ com.xyz.package1
+ com.xyz.package2

Mike
